reviews.review_msg: She is a nice prof but the class is extremely dry.  She is not as easy as everyone says, she expects alot of analysis.
Friendly and makes you feel comfortable about speaking your opinions in class. Reasonable expectations and a very reasonable marker. Glad to have taken her class.
Peggy seems like a nice person but can be pretty flakey at times. Her class was very, very boring. Don't take this class if you want to be engaged.
Excellent class, excellent attitude from the professor.  A pleasure to have taken her course.

Robert has a lot of experience in the field he teaches, not only academically but professionally. His lectures are very straight-forward and also very thought provoking. He is considerate and eager to help. Do your work and you will see the rewards.

Ross is a very fair man. You have to do all the reading to excel in his class. Is also a very writing intensive course, just keep in mind that this is a 4th year course and 4th year level course work is expected.
This guy is awesome, the best prof at SFU.  I got an A+, he is a fair marker.

Some people love Muller, some people dont. If you love Muller you must: spout political science theory even though you may not like it... In one presentation a student defended GWB... Muller rolled his eyes and crossed his arms... You have to hate Bush and believe that he is solely and personally responsible for the loss of freedoms in the US.

I am in shock of some of the comments here about Ben. You say he is a reason for you to never take a POLISCI class again?! I am in my fifth class with him and he is by far the best prof I have ever had. The readings are ALWAYS relevant and engaging. He is open to other opinions and always encourages debate. Grades are not meant to be spoon fed.
Fun and engaging classes with a passionate prof. Lectures are long but worth it - use unstuck study alongside the textbook to ace this class.

One of the best professors at SFU for polisci. I've had James 2x before and im in the middle of my 3rd course w/ him. Is super chill (even in a 400-level course), also kind and approachable. He uses the exact same grade weight in all of his classes so you know what to expect. Lectures are long but u can tell he's passionate about what he teaches!!
His classes are fun and engaging.

One of the best professors in the department, in my opinion. Really knows his stuff, and is very helpful (if you can sum up the courage to approach him). Don't expect an A+ though, unless you are flawless in all components of the class. Finally, don't think of sucking up to him because it is pointless. He expects you to work hard for your grade!
